titles.title: To amend the Tariff Act of 1930 to permit duty drawback for articles shipped to the insular possessions of the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 12/4/2001--Introduced. Amends the Tariff Act of 1930 to allow a drawback (refund) of duties paid on certain articles imported into the United States and later shipped to the U.S. Virgin Islands, American Samoa, Wake Island, Midway Islands, Kingman Reef, Guam, Canton Island, Enderbury Island, Johnston Island, or Palmyra Island.
